title: Seth Howander
text:
Seth Simon Oscar Howander (6 October 1892 – 14 September 1981) was a <a href="Sweden">Swedish</a> <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a>, <a href="bandy">bandy</a> and <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player who competed in the <a href="1920%20Summer%20Olympics">1920 Summer Olympics</a>.
In 1920 he was a member of the <a href="Sweden%20national%20men%27s%20ice%20hockey%20team">Swedish ice hockey team</a> which finished fourth in the <a href="Ice%20hockey%20at%20the%201920%20Summer%20Olympics">Summer Olympics tournament</a>. He played five matches as <a href="goaltender">goaltender</a>.
Ice hockey didn't exist in Sweden at the time. All members of the team were bandy players.
